comment._content: If you have any information regarding the individuals within the picture, please leave  a comment.

comment.author: 30652332@N00
comment._content: Judging from Friedl’s clothing the dates would seem to fall in the early twenties, as women's fashion in the era allowed for more comfortable looks, particularly when engaging in sport. Such as this image from 1924. Joseph Roth led a very interesting life though he seems to be relatively unknown. He’s definitely worthy of more research. Another Website With More Pictures New York Times Book Review. Short bio of Joseph and Friedl… “Joseph Roth was born in Brody in Galicia, then part of the Habsburg Monarchy, now Ukraine, on September 26, 1894 in the family of Maria (Miriam) Roth nee Gruebel and Nahum Roth. He worked as a journalist before focusing on writing novels and short stories. Joseph Roth died in the Necker hospital in Paris on May 27, 1939. His wife, Friederike (Friedl), who was diagnosed with schizophrenia in 1928, lived in an Austrian mental sanatorium, where she was killed in the Nazi euthanasia program in 1940.”

comment.author: 30364394@N02
comment._content: A wonderful image. But can anyone confirm that these are indeed Joseph and Friedl Roth? Looking at faces and postures I must say I have my doubts. And did not know that Joseph was such a good rider.
